techmeme.title: Google says Search AI Overviews, Gemini image generation, and other AI products will not respond to election-related topics ahead of the US elections (Aisha Malik/TechCrunch)
Sources: the cryptology part of France's charges against Pavel Durov raises concerns at US tech companies with E2EE messaging apps, like Signal, Apple, and Meta (New York Times)
Investor note: 360 One valued Bengaluru-based VerSe, which runs popular news aggregator Dailyhunt, at $2.9B in June 2024, down from its ~$5B valuation in 2022 (Manish Singh/TechCrunch)
Once hesitant to openly comment on politics, German tech leaders voice their opposition to the far right AfD party before September 1's elections in two states (J.D. Capelouto/Semafor)
AnandTech shuts down after covering PC and mobile hardware for over 27 years; publisher Future plans to keep AnandTech's website and articles live indefinitely (Ryan Smith/AnandTech)
